title: Nicola McLean says Coleen Rooney is 'used to being betrayed' in scathing attack
text:

Nicola McLean has claimed Coleen Rooney is "used to being betrayed" in a scathing attack on This Morning.

The reality TV star lashed out at Coleen in a brutal takedown after she accused someone using Rebekah Vardy's account of selling stories about her to the press.

Nicola insisted Coleen "chose to put a pregnant woman under this much stress" and claimed Becky's unborn baby may be 'harmed' .

She turned the tables on Wayne Rooney's wife by asking why she hasn't "outed" other people in her life before hinting at her own private controversies.

Speaking on This Morning, Nicola said: "If Coleen wants to be this outspoken why isn’t she outing other people in her life as well?"

(Image: ITV)

(Image: Getty Images)

Vanessa Feltz, who was also part of the debate on whether expectant mother should get preferential treatment, gave her opposing view.

In response, she said: "I don't see why really. Why should she? If you feel you've been targeted, betrayed, someone who is supposed to be your friend..."

Before she could finish, Nicola added: "She's used to being betrayed."

(Image: waynerooney/Instagram)

(Image: ITV)

Coleen has stuck by husband Wayne through numerous indiscretions and infidelities - with news emerging in 2002 he slept with three prostitutes, including a rubber-suited granny.

In September 2010, the Sunday Mirror exclusively revealed that Wayne had been spending family money on secret hotel sessions with Jenny Thompson while Coleen was pregnant with their first son, Kai, in 2009.

Shortly after it then emerged that he'd had a threesome with Jenny and another prostitute, Helen Wood.

Both escorts apologised to Coleen through the press and Helen claimed to the Sunday Mirror that Wayne had regretted the threeway as soon as it was over.

(Image: COPYRIGHT UNKNOWN)

In the early hours of September 1 2017, Rooney was arrested and charged with drink-driving after being pulled over by officers following a night out.

He was driving party girl Laura Simpson's VW Beetle through Wilmslow, Cheshire, when he was stopped by police and taken to a station for questioning.

Coleen, who was pregnant with her and Wayne's fourth child Cass, was on holiday in Majorca at the time of the arrest, and rang Laura and demanded she told the truth about her night with Rooney.

The WAG later forgave Wayne in an emotional public statement, admitting that she had come close to ending their relationship .

(Image: Ken McKay/ITV/REX/Shutterstock)

(Image: ITV)

Also during the This Morning interview, Nicola slammed Coleen for causing a WAG war while Becky was pregnant.

She revealed her friend had been subjected to horrific abuse, including death threats, which she believes is causing stress.

Speaking on This Morning, she said: "We’ve got a pregnant woman here, no matter who it is, who shouldn't be subjected to all this abuse.

"Coleen Rooney, she’s a mother, she knows this is not acceptable. Until Rebekah Vardy is proven guilty come off it, this is not OK."

Furious Nicola went further with her wild claims against Coleen and even took aim at This Morning for airing the WAGatha Christie debate.

Nicola said: "Forget who it is. Whether it’s a celebrity, a WAG or a normal person. Pregnancy, we all know stress can cause so much upset.

"We’ve just had a report from psychiatrists not that long ago that it it can affect the baby's brain."

On the trolling, she added: "I know I've been reading it personally. It’s horrific. 'Hope the unborn baby dies. Hope they both die'. This level of abuse is horrific, especially if your pregnant."

*This Morning airs weekdays on ITV at 10.30am
description: Rebekah Vardy's close friend turned the tables on Wayne Rooney's wife by hinting at her own private controversies
